problem.p: There are 10 points \(A,B,\ldots\) in a plane, no three on the same line.

ul.li: How many lines are determined by the points?
How many of the lines pass through \(A\), \(B\), or both?
How many of the lines do not pass through \(A\) or \(B\)?
How many triangles are determined by the points?
How many of the triangles contain point \(A\)?
How many of the triangles contain the side \(AB\)?
